meanings.definition: Capable of deep thought or reflection.
meanings.sent1: She had an excogitative expression on her face as she pondered the problem.
meanings.sent2: The excogitative student spent hours contemplating the meaning of life.
meanings.sent3: The excogitative cat sat by the window, staring at the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: His excogitative mind was like a labyrinth, full of twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The excogitative philosopher delved into the complexities of human nature.

meanings.sent1: The excogitative approach to the project ensured all angles were explored.
meanings.sent2: She took an excogitative approach to the problem, weighing all possible solutions.
meanings.sent3: The excogitative detective meticulously examined every clue at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: His excogitative nature made him the perfect candidate for the research team.
meanings.sent5: The excogitative scientist analyzed the data with precision and accuracy.
